course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Introductory Physics
course.description: This course is for students with no physics background. It can serve as a standalone introduction to physics or as a preparatory course for students who intend to take PHYS 1112. It is not a preparatory course for PHYS 1111; students with no calculus background who plan to take General Physics should take calculus concurrently with PHYS 1101 so that they meet the prerequisites for PHYS 1112. Topics covered include heat and gases, force and motion, waves, and electricity and magnetism.
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x Physics or HKDSE 1x Physics; any PHYS courses at 1100-level or above

reviews.author: Issac Lam
reviews.title: Free PDF files here!!
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus:
Force and motion
Heat and temperature
----------midterm exam----------
Magnetic field and electricity
Wave motion
----------final exam----------

The midterm exam only covers the first 2 topics, whereas the final exam covers all topics.

Midterm:
--> 7 long questions
--> full mark is 70
--> Time allowed 90 mins
--> 1 piece of A4 cheatsheet (2 pages) is allowed
--> closed book
Final:
--> 15 long questions
--> full mark is 150
--> Time allowed 2 hrs 45 mins
--> 2 pieces of A4 cheatsheet (4 pages) are allowed
--> closed book
Assignment:
--> 24 in total
--> Submit around 2 each week
--> Total marks for each assignment is 30
--> 3 questions in each assignment
--> Steps are needed

The topics covered are not hard, just HKDSE stuff.
Calculations are not difficult. There is no differentiation and integration.

Apart from reading the PowerPoint slides given by Dr Ng, you are also strongly recommended to read relevant topics in the reference textbook 'Physics Technology Update 4th Edition' and do its exercise.
Questions in your assignments also come from this textbook.

Textbook pdf file:
https://acrobat.adobe.com/link/review?uri=urn:aaid:scds:US:38c72efa-9974-30ab-ae01-77cea78815f5

Textbook questions solution pdf file:
https://acrobat.adobe.com/link/review?uri=urn:aaid:scds:US:8dec0b41-e3a9-3c84-8af3-01e2e6a9f731
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Ng's teaching is fair. In every lesson, he explains the laws and fundamentals of physics by asking his teaching assistant to perform experiments for us.
Besides, he often explains physics with the aid of movie clips.

However, one lecture is quite long (1hr 50 mins). Although there is a 5 mins break in the middle of every lesson, it is still somewhat difficult to concentrate throughout the entire lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. You will likely get a B if your marks are around the mean.

Assignments: 25%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 50%

The final exam contributes the most to your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy.
All you need to do is basically finish all your assignments every week and attend the exams.
It is not a must to go to the lectures (but you better do) as no attendance will be taken.

*for your cheatsheets, you are strongly recommended to write down the equations and formulas*

reviews.author: Q_L
reviews.title: Speedrunning DSE Physics in 4 months
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the DSE stuff (compulsory part)

Textbook Adopted:
- Physics--Technology Update

Content:
1. Force & Motion
  - Position and movement (Kinematics)
  - Force and motion (Dynamics)
  - Projectile motion
  - Work, energy, and power
  - Momentum
  - Uniform circular motion

2. Heat & Gases
  - Temperature, heat, and internal energy
  - Transfer processes
  - Change of state
  - Gases

3. Electricity & Magnetism
  - Electrostatics
  - Circuits and domestic electricity
  - Electromagnetism

4. Wave Motion
  - Nature and properties of waves
  - Light
  - Sound
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Ng is very nice, but each lecture contain two hours so it is difficult for me to stay focus.

Tutorial sessions: TA just explain the homework or the examples in the book. Not very useful since you can read them by yourself
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 25%

Midterm Exam 25%
-Closed-book
-One cheat sheet is allowed (TwoÂ pages, A4 size)
Mean: 38.62/70
SD: 18.77
Me: 56/70

Final Exam 50%
-Closed-book
-Two cheat sheets are allowed (Four pages, A4 size)
Mean: 84.3/139
SD: 31.9
Me: 126/139

I think the exam questions are quite straightforward and most of them are easier than the DSE level. The grading is Fair if you work hard.
(Update: I heard that the exam paper is more difficult now, probably because 22-23 Fall is the first semester of this course)

My grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Overall, I think the workload is high since I have don't have much knowledge in physics.
I spent some time to study after each lecture and ask for my friend's help. It took me some time to understand the concept.
Each week have two assignments (three questions in each assignment).
Besides doing the exercises in the book, I also suggest you to do those DSE or CE questions before the exam

reviews.author: Flying P
reviews.comment_content:
Lectures
1) Force and Motion (9 lectures)
2) Heat and Gases (5 Lectures)
3) Electricity and Magnetism (5 Lectures)
4) Wave Motion (5 Lectures)

Basic things in DSE Physics

every week have Tutorial  discuss the assignment and review the content taught in lectures
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr NG is a nice guy, after the lecture he willing to answer the questions that you raised.

During the lecture there are different experiment demonstrations to explain the content that told.

Also, He use some movie clip to explain is the film scientific correct. I think this make the class more interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 25%
Mid term Exam 25%
-Closed-book
-One "cheat sheet" is allowed (Two pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)
Final Exam 50%
-Closed-book
-Two "cheat sheets" are allowed (Four pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)
reviews.comment_workload:
-Each assignment have 3 questions.
-2 assignments per week
-Assignment/exam solutions and selected worked examples in the adopted textbook will be discussed at tutorials.
-TWO lowest-score assignments (in comparison with other submitted ones) will be dropped, i.e., NOT counted towards the final grade.

If you pay attention during the class you will know how to do the assignments.

Just like practices after lectures.

reviews.comment_content:

Il. Heat and Gases (5 Lectures)

ï¿¼ï¿¼ï¿¼Each Week: TWO 1 hour and 50 minutes lecture + ONE 50 minutes tutorial (No attendance is recorded)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Fai Jai has delivered the class in a moderate pace, with explaining the concepts with examples in an interesting way. Also, there are some experiment demonstrations during the lecture.
At tutorial sessions, TA would explain the assignment question (the week after the submission of the assignment), and sometimes explain the worked examples on textbook.
Overall, the teaching of this course is easy to understand.
*No recording in revision (?)
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%
Midterm Exam 25%
Final Exam 50%

Grading: Unknownðð» (Because I do not take the mid-term examination and final examination)
------------------------------------------
In mid-term examination and final examination:
* One "cheat sheet" is allowed (TwoÂ pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)
* Physical constants, typical values, prefixes, unit conversion formulae, etc. will be provided in the exam questions
Question Type: No MCQ; Short questions and long questions [Structured questions] => Examination would be similar
reviews.comment_workload:
Weekly assignment required:
Around 2 assignments per week; Each assignment has 3 questions
The assignment is hand-written

attachments.name: Course Syllabus for PHYS1101 Introductory Physics

reviews.author: Wit Lee
reviews.comment_content:
I. Force and Motion (9 Lectures)
   - Position and movement (Kinematics)
   - Force and motion (Dynamics)
   - Projectile motion
   - Work, energy, and power
   - Momentum
   - Uniform circular motion
II. Heat and Gases (5 Lectures)
    - Temperature, heat, and internal energy
    - Transfer processes
    - Change of state
    - Gases
III. Electricity and Magnetism (5 Lectures)

    - Circuits and domestic electricity
    - Electromagnetism
IV. Wave Motion (5 Lectures)
    - Nature and properties of waves

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Ng is a really nice person, the pace of the lecture was well-controlled by him. There was film shown to student which is for demonstrating the physics in the film and experiment when the lecture was near to the end.He would give a lot of esay example to explain the compilcated physics in order to let us understand the lecture more easily.  There was a break in every lecture and student can feel free to seek the help of professor Ng. He may try his best to allow u to understand the physics question u asked.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading for me is OKAY. I got 80% marks in both my mid term exam and final exam. Most of my assignment is about full mark.(most  of student got full marks actually)The final grading of me is an A
Weigh Percentage:(according to my bad memory)
Assignment 25%
mid-term 25%
final exam 50%
reviews.comment_workload: It's about two assignment per week which related to the lecture. Each of them was about 3 question. If u were understand the lecture, it wouldn't take much of ur time. The course is for people who didn't studied dse physics before. If u are concentrated enough during the lecture, I think the content won't really be ur burden.

but SD quite high, thirty something in final exam

fair

one mid-term
final
that's all

reviews.author: jellycat
reviews.comment_content:
1.Force and Motion
2.Heat and Gases
3.Electricity and Magnetism
4.Wave Motion
Midterm:one cheat sheet is allowed
Final:two cheat sheet is allowed
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ng is very nice and passionate about teaching physic.The lecture is close to lunchtime, so he allow us to eat during lesson. In most of the lecture, he will let TA to perform some experiments which make us feel less boring and get to know the concept better.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is nice
25% for midterm
50% for final
25% for assignment (there are 24 assigments, assignments during add drop period will not be counted, the lowest two assignments will be excluded.)
reviews.comment_workload: For no physic background, the workload is high, as the course will teach a bunch of new concepts in a short period of time,which is very intense. I suggest you can take a look at the lecture note before lesson. If you still donât get the concept, you can ask professors or watch online YouTube videos.Beside, make sure you finish all the textbooks exercise, it is super useful.Some of the questions will even appear in the exam.

reviews.author: palak
reviews.comment_content: Not having any prior knowledge about physics, the content was considerably a lot.  There isn't any attendance requirement for this course, for the lecture or the tutorials.
reviews.comment_teaching: I attended a few lectures, they were lengthy and got quite boring from time to time. However, the professor is great and you can understand if you pay attention.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading I believe was okay, the assignments saved my grade overall.  The assignments and the midterm have the same weighting(25%), and the final has a 50% weighting
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is acceptable, every weekend 1-2 assignments were due, which weren't too time consuming

reviews.author: Harlez
reviews.comment_content:
Content is relatively basic and easy to understand covering topics such as:
Force and motion
Heat and gases
Electricty and Magnetism
Wave motion.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor mostly just followed the ppt, however he also included some demonstrations during the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was fine and the tests were relatively easy since the professor allowed cheat sheets.

Midterm:
Full marks are 70, mean 38.62, max 70, min 4 (0 for absence), and std 18.77
My mark: 70/70

Final:
Full marks are 139, mean 84.3, max 137, min 6 (0 for absence), and std 31.9
My mark: 131/139

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments a week that includes 3~ish questions. So the workload was pretty light. There were also some worked examples that you can do which the TA covers in the tutorials.

reviews.author: Manki0v0
reviews.title: DSE Physics basically
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to highschool DSE physics syllabus but easier.
Covers various topics:
Force and Motion
Heat and gases
electromagnetism
Wave Motion
It's comparatively easier than dse one cuz no paper 2 electives and raidioactivity stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ng is very nice, he would listen to students' requests like using cheat sheets in mid-term and final. Sometimes he will adjust the syllabus to make them easier to understand
reviews.comment_grading:
assignment 25%
mid-term 25%
final 50%
For both midterm and final, you are required to answer around 10 questions.
Calculators are permitted.
1 cheat sheet(2 pages) for mid-term
2 cheat sheets for final exam
I copied down various commonly seen question type and formulas which turned out to be handy during the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments per week with around 5 short questions, mostly utilizing the formulas taught during lectures

reviews.author: Zane
reviews.title: Good Grade!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Very simple physics content, not too difficult, no need to come and listen if you have learned physics before (unless you want a very good grade)

Content:
1. Force & Motion
  - Position and movement (Kinematics)
  - Force and motion (Dynamics)
  - Projectile motion
  - Work, energy, and power
  - Momentum
  - Uniform circular motion

2. Heat & Gases
  - Temperature, heat, and internal energy
  - Transfer processes
  - Change of state
  - Gases

3. Electricity & Magnetism
  - Electrostatics
  - Circuits and domestic electricity
  - Electromagnetism

4. Wave Motion
  - Nature and properties of waves
  - Light
  - Sound
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course is really long, 2 and a half hours a session
It's hard to concentrate for long periods of time, especially when the content isn't always engaging
reviews.comment_grading:
25% of assignments
I get full marks for most of my assignments

25% for mid-term
70/70 can have cheat sheet

50% at the end of the term
118/125 can have a cheat sheet

I got an A in the end, which was not too difficult overall
There is still some difficulty in getting an A+ (the exam needs to be infinitely close to a perfect score)
reviews.comment_workload:
The homework for a lesson is basically 5 application problems, which can be done relatively quickly after the lesson
Of course there will be some content that you will need to study online (very little)

It takes a long time to do the cheat sheet before the exam, but it is also a good revision process

reviews.author: Jennyæ®é¨
reviews.comment_content: The content is far more than I expected, and we also include magnetism, which might be a little tricky. But the difficulty is suited for a student who abandoned physics in grade 10.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style is well. One thing is that the professor will stop providing recordings to students after add and drop period. And compared to reading PowerPoint, I prefer to attend lectures to help me comprehend.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was good. You can undoubtedly get an A range if you understand the contents.
reviews.comment_workload: Two assignments a week correspond to the two lectures. ï¼It takes me some time sicne I'm not good at physics.)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures: The Prof teach things at a proper pace and include experiments, but it's quite boring. Youtube would probably be better if you want to understand

Tutorial: The TA would just explain the assignments and teach the assignments from the book

Practice worked examples, assignments, past papers.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%
Midterm 25%
Final 50%
Graded by a curve
Mid-term: 1 Cheat sheet is allowed
Finals: 2 Cheat sheet is allowed
This means you can print out examples with answers, and formulas, for the exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week there is 2 assignments with at least 3 questions

Buy the book (Physics Technology Update) would probably be better as there are more examples some of the mid-term and finals questions are from the book

reviews.author: betabass
reviews.comment_content:
1. Position and movement (Kinematics)
2. Force and motion (Dynamics)
3. Projectile motion
4. Work, energy, and power
5. Momentum
6. Uniform circular motion
7. Temperature, heat, and internal energy
8. Transfer processes
9. Change of state
10. Gases
11. Electrostatics
12. Circuits and domestic electricity
13. Electromagnetism
14. Nature and properties of waves
15. Light
16. Sound
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's teaching is clear, just that he could speak a little bit faster. He is very passionate about physics and wants us to learn the most of it. He's always willing to answer every students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
22 Assignments worth 10 marks each (max:220) 25%:
Similar questions come out from the textbook which was recommended by this course, so try the textbook questions.
Max: N/A
Mean: N/A
SD: N/A
Me: 216/220

Midterm (max:70) 25%:
All writing questions, so make sure that you are confident with every step.
1 cheat sheet allowed.
Max: 70
Mean: 38.62
SD: 18.77
Me: 69/70

Final (max:139) 50%
Similar to midterm, but around twice the length, twice the time.
2 cheat sheets allowed.
Max: 137
Mean: 84.3
SD: 31.9
Me:133/139

Result: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very light for a 4-credit course. Every week there are around 5-6 questions that takes less than an hour to get them done. Just make sure that your answers show workings and explanation.

Also, the exams marks are pretty generous (e.g. error carry forward)

reviews.author: TC6535531
reviews.comment_content:
forces and motion (position and movement, force and motion, projectile motion, work, energy and power, momentum, uniform circular motion)
heat and gases (temperature, heat, and internal energy, transfer processes, change of state, gases)
electricity and magnetism (electrostatics, circuits and domestic electricity, electromagnetism)
wave motion (nature and properties waves, light, sound)
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ng is funny. Also it has some experiments operated by the TA during class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25% (20 assignments + 2 bonus)
Midterm Exam 25% (covering forces and motion, heat and gases)
Final Exam 50% (covering all the topics)
reviews.comment_workload: you will have 2 assignments every week, each assignment contains 2-3 questions.

reviews.author: Acceleratoru
reviews.comment_content:
I forces and motion
II heat and gases
III electricity and magnetism
IV wave motion
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Ng is very humorous, the experiments at the end of lectures are very fun and funny. However sometimes I get a bit confused while he was explaining some concepts, to be honest I believe the textbook "Physics Technology Update" is more helpful than the teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: out of 10 marks each. Full marks for all assignments except one got 9.5/10
Midterm - 68/70. Mean 38.62, max 70, min 4, std 18.77.
Final - 124/139. mean 84.3, max 137, min 6 (0 for absence), and std 31.9
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: 24 assignments. Each assignment consists of 3 questions. Takes about 30min - 1hr to finish.

Some time will have a small physics experiment in class to show.
prof. are funny but TA are boring
One drawback is that the classes are quite lengthy (110 minutes each). Even though we had a short break of 5 minutes after every class, it was hard to stay focused for the whole duration of the lecture.
TA are so hea Just follow PowerPoint

Assignments: 25%

reviews.author: Leoml
reviews.comment_content:
The course is easy, much easier than dse physics. 4 aspects of physics are covered: 1.force and motion 2.heat and gases, 3. Electricity and magnetism 4. Wave motion
Full syllabus can be found in other reviews.
Somehow better than phys1112 and others since exam is long question.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ng uploads the lecture slides on canvas before lecture and present it during lectures, his accent is great. However the examples given on class is not enough. So boring, but he had tried his best.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%, midterm 25%, final 50%
Graded on a curve, shouldn't be too bad if you worked hard.
The mean of midterm is 39/70, final is 84/139
I got 62/70 and 132/139 in midterm and final respectively.
Total: ~91%
Grade: A?? (Seems the cut off is quite high for A+)
reviews.comment_workload: Light. 2 assignments per week, the workload is just right for a 4 credit course. But I prefer more exercises.

reviews.author: CMchan
reviews.comment_content:
I. Force and motion (9 lectures)
II. Heat and Gases (5 lectures)
III. Electricity and Magnetism (5 lectures)
IV. Wave Motion (5 lectures)
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ng is very friendly, he is willing to answer students' questions. Every time I send an email to him, he replies me immediately.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Assignment
25% Midterm
50% Final exam

Me:
Assignment: one 9.5/10, others 10/10
Midterm:67/70
Final:130/139
Total:~95%
Grade:A+
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments per week
But if you want to get a good grade, you should do all the worked examples in textbook.(I pay lots of efforts in the midterm and the final.)

reviews.author: lovesonlyu
reviews.comment_content:
Just the compulsory part of DSE Physics with less content.
1. Force & Motion
2. Heat & Gases
3. Electricity & Magnetism
4. Wave Motion

If you won't study physics after this course, actually you don't really need to understand the abstract concept especially those in E&M. You can still answer the questions correctly.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I only attend 2 lectures and tutorials because of three reasons.

1. Teaching is quite boring. Professor mainly repeats the content on the ppt.
2. The air-cons in LT-B are very cold.
3. TA who is responsible for the experiment in the lecture has a terrible accent and I am not sure about what he is doing. Also, I learn nothing from his tutorial. It is just going through the book exercises and assignments that I can do the same at home.

Reading textbooks may help you more than attending lectures. It may only take about 30 minutes for you to finish the content but a lecture last for 2 hours.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 25%
Mid-term: 25% (max:70 mean:38.62 std:18.77)
Final: 50% (max:137 mean:84.3 std:31.9)

Me:
Assignment: 25/25
Mid-term: 60/70 (higher than mean by 1.1std)
Final: 102/139 (higher than mean by 0.55std)
Grade: A-

The grade is fair. You can still receive a lot of partial credits even if your answer is incorrect. I thought I can only get 45 in mid-term but the final outcome is 60.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 2 assignments per week that can be finished in half an hour.
As long as you are able to finish them by yourself and do revision before the exam, you can get a satisfactory grade.
Not heavy for a 4-credits course.
However you should put more time in this course because it is a 4-credits course.

reviews.author: mading18
reviews.title: Get ready to speedrun physics in 5 months
reviews.comment_content:
Part 1: Forces and Motion (9 lectures)
Part 2: Temperature and Gases (5 lectures)
Part 3: Electricity and Magnetism (5 lectures)
Part 4: Sound and Light Waves (5 lectures)
Pretty much the curriculum of most high school physics courses like in DSE, IB, AP, etc but condensed into a single semester. Some label this as "General Physics 1 With Calculus but without the calculus"; I can't really agree but content still isn't the easiest
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ng is okay at teaching; he teaches the content well and has a decent sense of humor but his lectures could get boring over the 2 hours. He does include live demonstrations that the TA's help with in every lecture to teach the content better

TA's answer questions when asked during tutorial sessions as well as go over worked examples and previous week assignments during tutorial sessions
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterms 25%
Assignments 25%
Finals 50%
Assignments are pretty easy if you understand the content taught.
Midterms and Finals, if you already know some basic physics concepts or you study a lot, are really easy. But I do understand that people who take this course enroll in this course with absolutely no knowledge about physics and may struggle a bit.

My scores:
Assignments: Mostly 10/10's or 9/10's
Midterms: 70/70
Finals: 133/139
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload despite assignments every week

You do have to do 2 assignments per week, but they are literally just 2-3 questions per assignment(just allocate 20 minutes to do the assignments a day after the lecture and you'll be fine there)

Whether or not you buy the textbook is completely your choice.
I must say however, that just doing assignments and worked examples would not be sufficient in this course to do well in exams. The content they give you apart from the textbook is simply not enough. Furthermore, like 70% of the questions from the finals were the medium difficulty questions in the chapter review sections of the textbook

You're allowed to write your own "data sheets" so no need to memorize formulas for this course; one A4 sized sheet for midterms, two for finals.
